docs.snippet: Some may argue that top earners are simply super skilled, but that’s not what the evidence suggests.
docs.lead_paragraph: Income inequality in the United States would fall drastically if people were compensated based only on their ability.
docs.abstract: Some may argue that top earners are simply super skilled, but that’s not what the evidence suggests.

headline.main: If People Were Paid by Ability, Inequality Would Plummet
headline.print_headline: If People Were Paid by Ability, Inequality Would Drop

docs.snippet: Critics and supporters discuss the legacy of a mayor who may now run for president.
docs.lead_paragraph: Michael Bloomberg has a dramatic story to tell of New York City’s transformation should he decide to enter the presidential race. The city was in recession and reeling from the Sept. 11 terrorist attacks when Mr. Bloomberg became mayor in 2002. By the time he left three terms later, vast stretches of New York had been redeveloped, with new parks, office towers, stadiums, employers and taxpaying residents where there were once blighted properties and industrial land.
docs.abstract: Critics and supporters discuss the legacy of a mayor who may now run for president.

headline.main: As Bloomberg’s New York Prospered, Inequality Flourished Too

byline.original: By Emily Badger and Luis Ferré-Sadurní

docs.lead_paragraph: SANTIAGO, Chile — The suddenness of the protests, the anger that spilled onto the streets every day, might have been surprising anywhere. But in the country often lauded as Latin America’s great economic success story, it has shocked the world.
docs.abstract: SANTIAGO, Chile — The suddenness of the protests, the anger that spilled onto the streets every day, might have been surprising anywhere. But in the country often lauded as Latin America’s great economic success story, it has shocked the world.

headline.main: ‘Chile Woke Up’: Dictatorship’s Legacy of Inequality Triggers Mass Protests
headline.print_headline: ‘Chile Woke Up’: A Legacy of Economic Inequality Incites Mass Protests

docs.snippet: Protesters are demanding a larger share of the nation’s prosperity — a reality check for its celebrated economic model.
docs.lead_paragraph: Chile is often praised as a capitalist oasis, a prospering and stable nation on a continent where both prosperity and stability have been in short supply. But that prosperity has accumulated mostly in the hands of a lucky few. As a result, Chile has one of the highest levels of economic inequality in the developed world.
docs.abstract: Protesters are demanding a larger share of the nation’s prosperity — a reality check for its celebrated economic model.

headline.main: Chile Learns the Price of Economic Inequality
headline.print_headline: Chile Learns the Price of Economic Inequality

byline.original: By Cnn New York Times Debate

docs.snippet: Bong Joon Ho’s latest film joins a growing list of movies criticizing South Korean inequality — a problem so pervasive it has given birth to its own slang.
docs.lead_paragraph: The title of the scathing new South Korean film “Parasite” refers to the Kim family, destitute basement dwellers who try to climb the social ladder by leeching off the wealthy Park family. While the Kims worry about money, the extravagant Parks worry about poor people’s unpleasant smell.
docs.abstract: Bong Joon Ho’s latest film joins a growing list of movies criticizing South Korean inequality — a problem so pervasive it has given birth to its own slang.

headline.main: ‘Parasite’ and South Korea’s Income Gap: Call It Dirt Spoon Cinema
headline.print_headline: Inequality Served With A Dirt Spoon
